thread.title: Idaho ties in the NFL (2015 Week 4): Buccaneers’ Martin passes 100-yard mark
thread.title_full: Idaho ties in the NFL (2015 Week 4): Buccaneers’ Martin passes 100-yard mark

title: Idaho ties in the NFL (2015 Week 4): Buccaneers’ Martin passes 100-yard mark
text:
View Full Gallery (12 Photos) 
Idaho ties in the NFL: 2015 Week 4 Associated Press photos of NFL players from Idaho colleges and high schools during Week 4 of the 2015 NFL season View Full Gallery PHELAN M. EBENHACK — The Associated Press 
Here’s a look at how NFL players from Idaho high schools and colleges fared during Week 4 of the 2015 NFL season: 
• Tampa Bay RB Doug Martin (No. 22, Boise State) ran for 106 yards and a touchdown on 20 carries against Carolina, his first 100-yard game since the 2014 finale. He also had five catches for 37 yards. Carolina DE Jared Allen (No. 69, Idaho State) started his team debut and had one solo tackle and one quarterback hit. Panthers TE/FB Richie Brockel (No. 47, Boise State) also played. 
• New Orleans TE Josh Hill (No. 89, Blackfoot High/Idaho State) had two catches for 11 yards and a TD against Dallas. Cowboys DE DeMarcus Lawrence (No. 90, Boise State) had his first regular-season sack among his five tackles (three solo, one for loss) and two QB hits. Dallas DT Tyrone Crawford (No. 98, Boise State) and New Orleans CB Kyle Wilson (No. 24, Boise State) also played. 
• Chicago ILB Shea McClellin (No. 50, Marsing High/Boise State) had five tackles (three solo) against Oakland. Bears LT Charles Leno Jr. (No. 72, Boise State) made his second career start and made a tackle on a Raiders fumble recovery. 
• Miami CB Jamar Taylor (No. 22, Boise State) made four solo tackles against the New York Jets in London. 
• Philadelphia DE Brandon Bair (No. 93, South Fremont High) started and had a solo tackle at Washington. Redskins S Jeron Johnson (No. 20, Boise State) also played. 
• Indianapolis RG Hugh Thornton (No. 69, Mountain View High) started against Jacksonville. Colts DT Billy Winn (No. 99, Boise State) also played. 
• Arizona LG Mike Iupati (No. 76, Idaho) started in his team debut against St. Louis. 
• Denver C Matt Paradis (No. 61, Council High/Boise State) started against Minnesota.
